locale.name: en_US
locale.message: This plugin enables the assignment of the Uniform Resource Names to the issues, articles and galleys in OJS.
URN (dnb)
Add Check Number
The URN is assigned to this {$pubObjectType}.
The URN {$pubId} has been assigned.
Assign the URN {$pubId} to this {$pubObjectType}
The URN cannot be assigned because the custom suffix is missing.
The URN {$pubId} cannot be assigned because it contains an unresolved pattern.
What you see is a preview of the URN. Select the checkbox and save the form to assign the URNdnb.
Clear Issue Objects URNs
Are you sure you wish to delete the existing issue objects URNs?
Use the following option to clear URNs of all galleys currently scheduled for this issue.
Clear URNdnb
Are you sure you wish to delete the existing URN?
The URN cannot be assigned because the custom suffix is missing.
The URN cannot be assigned because it contains an unresolved pattern or this galleys locale is not the submission's main locale.
issue
galley
article
The given URN suffix is already in use for another published item. Please enter a unique URN suffix for each item.
URN (dnb)
The check number is missing.
Check Number
The check number will be automatically calculated and added at the end, as the last digit of an URNdnb.
Please configure the URN plugin to be able to manage and use URNs in OJS:
Issues
Galleys
Articles
Please select the publishing objects that will have Uniform Resource Names (URNdnb) assigned:
The URN prefix pattern must be in the form "urndnb:"<NID>":"<NSS>.
Please enter the resolver URL.
Choose
The persistent identifier namespace usually needed for the registration (e.g. at the Deutsche Nationalbibliothek).
Namespace
Journal Content
Please choose the objects URNs should be assigned to.
The URN prefix is the fix, never changing part of the URN (e.g. "urn:nbn:de:0000-").
URN Prefix
Are you sure you wish to delete all existing URNs?

If you change your URN configuration, URNs that have already been assigned will not be affected. Once the URN configuration is saved, use this button to clear all existing URNs so that the new settings will take effect with existing objects.
Reassign URNs
Please enter the URN suffix pattern for galleys.
(e.g. http://nbn-resolving.de/)
Resolver URL
Please enter the URN suffix pattern for articles.
Enter an individual URN suffix for each published item. You'll find an additional URN input field on each item's metadata page.
%j.v%vi%i.%a.g%g
Use default patterns.
A URN suffix can take any form, but must be unique among all publishing objects with the same URN prefix assigned:
For example, vol%viss%ipp%p could create the URN suffix "vol3iss2pp230".

Use the pattern entered below to generate URN suffixes. Use %j for Journal initials, %v for the volume number, %i for the issue number, %Y for the year, %a for the OJS article ID, %g for the OJS galley ID, %f for the OJS file ID, %p for the page number and %x for "Custom Identifier".
URN Suffix
